laboratory_examinations.findings: Initial abnormally high TSH level detected was 494 mIU/L (cut off <120 mIU/L).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: At day 11, TSH was re-examined at 8.00 mIU/L (normal range 0.44–8.80 mIU/L). At the time of severe hypothyroidism diagnosis, TSH was 446 mIU/L (normal values 0.50–4.30 mIU/L).

laboratory_examinations.findings: Initially, free T4 was measured at 40.1 ng/dL (normal range 0.9–1.6 ng/dL).
Normal level of TBG was 25.2 µg/mL (normal range 16.3–30.7 µg/mL).
Serum thyroglobulin was high at 3000 ng/mL (normal range 2.0–35.0 ng/mL).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: After 6 weeks of treatment, thyroglobulin was 1668 ng/mL; it continued to decrease, reaching 204 ng/mL after 15 months of treatment.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Ultrasonography showed multinodular enlargement of the thyroid gland.
Reduced diffuse iodide uptake was 5.4% 24 hours after oral administration of 100 µCi 123I (normal range is 10%–40%).
